Add io.prestosql.plugin.hive.HiveQueryRunner.Builder#withTpchPartitionedTables()

please partition by shiptdate which is more natural
Partitioning on shiptdate gives ~2.5K partitions which makes the test setup very slow (triggers major GC a lot on my laptop). Partitioning suppkey gives 100 partitions which works well for testing.
Ok. Since this is for just single test, Let's just create appropriate tables in test itself instead of using artificial keys
Done
let's avoid artificial partitioning.
Removed this
could we add a test for getDiscreteValuesCount too? I think you can use row_type for this (I don't think row types are orderable).

RowType is orderable as long as the fields within are themselves orderable. I think we can use ColorType.
For testing getDiscreteValuesCount specifically, would it be ok we add a test in TestDynamicFilterService instead (maybe separate PR) ? It will be much easier to do it there.

would it be ok we add a test in TestDynamicFilterService instead (maybe separate PR)

Yes, that works too
I don't think it's needed. We short-circut on all predicate.

Didn't follow this completely, my intent is to unblock the probe side scheduling as soon as we have a useful (not all) filter available from DynamicFilter without waiting for full completion. The future from isBlocked can complete multiple times with an all before giving a not all filter, so I used the condition !dynamicFilter.isComplete() && dynamicFilter.getCurrentPredicate().isAll() before blocking on the future from dynamicFilter.isBlocked()
put each condition in bulletpoints
Done

does orTimeout(timeLeft, MILLISECONDS) cancel delegate future?
This is a bug in Presto. Futures returned in DynamicFilter are not resilient against cancellation. Could you fix it?
We probably should wrap these in MoreFutures#unmodifiableFuture(java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<V>, boolean) in Presto main
Added a commit for wrapping in unmodifiableFuture

Reverted these changes
nit: this should go to separate commit

question: is it a consistent same scanned row count every time?

Yes, we use text storage format and partitioned joins so the only pruning here should come from DF and it should be consistent due to the probe blocking logic. I've updated it to assert for specific row count now.

Added

@sopel39 FYI I tweaked this test a bit to assert on completion of only one filter. I was seeing some flakiness without this because the probe side gets unblocked after receiving one filter and the query can sometimes finish before DynamicFilterService is able to collect the 2nd filter. If I set experimental.dynamic-filtering-refresh-interval to a very low value like 20ms then the flakiness goes away.
After changing to wait on full DF, the above tweak is no longer needed
please remove dynamicFilter.getCurrentPredicate().isAll() predicate from if
